inlineContent.text: With the Translation framework, you can offer in-app translations from one language to another. To display simple system translations in your app, use the
translation overlay.
For a more customizable translation experience, use the

object and its associated translation methods. With the customizable translation APIs, the framework asks a person for permission to download the language translation models, if necessary. You can translate strings efficiently, while checking for language availability before offering a translation.
This sample code project provides the
sample app to demonstrate various methods of translating text. It consists of the following translation demos:
Translate Text
Replace Text
Single String
Batch All at Once
Batch as a Sequence
Language Availability
Prepare for Translation
This sample code project is associated with WWDC24 session
Before you run the sample code project, download and install Xcode 16 or later.
This sample code project runs only in macOS and on physical iOS devices. It doesnâ€™t translate text in iOS or iPadOS simulators.
To run the sample code project in macOS, select My Mac from the Xcode toolbar scheme menu, and then choose Project > Run.
To run the sample code on a physical iOS device:
Upgrade your device to iOS 18 or later.
Select your device from the Xcode toolbar scheme menu.
Select the
project.
Click the
target and select your team from the Team menu in the Signing & Capabilities pane to let Xcode automatically manage your provisioning profile. For more information, see
Choose Project > Run.

inlineContent.text: The Language Availability demo shows how to check whether the framework supports a specific language pairing before offering it to people. A person selects a source and a target language from a picker, and the sample passes that language pairing to a function in the view model that checks whether the framework supports that pairing. The view then updates the display when the model sets the
variable.

let status = await availability.status(from: source, to: target)

inlineContent.text: The framework doesnâ€™t support translation between the same language, such as British English (en-GB) and U.S. English (en-US).
If you know which languages a translation needs, you can download the language models before offering the translation.
The Prepare for Translation demo shows how to initiate the download of a language pairing by creating a
instance with the source and target language to download. The sample then calls
on the session the translation task returns. If the languages arenâ€™t already downloaded, a view appears that requests permission to download them.

inlineContent.text: For testing, you can delete locally downloaded models in macOS by choosing System Settings > General > Language & Region > Translation Languages. In iOS, you can manage your downloaded languages by choosing Settings > Apps > Translate > Downloaded Languages if you have the system Translate app installed locally on your device.
